tool.name: scaff
tool.command:
soapdenovo2_scaff.py
## Inputs --arc=$arc --pegrads=$pegrads --pregraph_basic=$pregraph_basic --updated_edge=$updated_edge --contig=$contig --read_in_gap=$read_in_gap --read_on_contig=$read_on_contig
## Check if using default or custom parameters --default_full_settings_type=$default_full_settings.settings_type #if $default_full_settings.settings_type == "full" --fill_gaps=$default_full_settings.fill_gaps --compatible_mode=$default_full_settings.compatible_mode --unmask_contigs=$default_full_settings.unmask_contigs --keep_contigs_connected=$default_full_settings.keep_contigs_connected --ass_visual=$default_full_settings.ass_visual --gap_len_diff=$default_full_settings.gap_len_diff --min_contig_len=$default_full_settings.min_contig_len --min_contig_cvg=$default_full_settings.min_contig_cvg --max_contig_cvg=$default_full_settings.max_contig_cvg --insert_size_upper_bound=$default_full_settings.insert_size_upper_bound --bubble_coverage=$default_full_settings.bubble_coverage --genome_size=$default_full_settings.genome_size --ncpu=$default_full_settings.ncpu #end if
## Outputs --new_contig_index=$new_contig_index --links=$links --scaf_gap=$scaf_gap --scaf=$scaf --gap_seq=$gap_seq --scaf_seq=$scaf_seq --contig_positions_scaff=$contig_positions_scaff --bubble_in_scaff=$bubble_in_scaff --scaf_stats=$scaf_stats

param.label: pregraph basic output from SOAPdenovo2 pregraph
param.name: pregraph_basic

param.label: updated edge output from SOAPdenovo2 contig
param.name: updated_edge

param.help: Default settings is suitable for most mapping needs. If you want full control, use Full parameter list
param.label: SOAP settings to use
param.name: settings_type

param.label: Use compatibility mode to build scaffold with contigs produced by version 1.05
param.name: compatible_mode

param.label: un-mask contigs with high/low coverage before scaffolding
param.name: unmask_contigs

param.label: Keep contigs weakly connected to other contigs in scaffold
param.name: keep_contigs_connected

param.label: Allowed length difference between estimated and filled gaps
param.name: gap_len_diff

param.help: Contigs shorter than 100bp with coverage smaller than c*avgCvg will be masked before scaffolding unless -u is set
param.label: Minimum contig coverage (c*avgCvg)
param.name: min_contig_cvg

param.help: Contigs with coverage larger than C*avgCvg or contigs shorter than 100bp with coverage larger than 0.8*C*avgCvg will be masked before scaffolding unless -u is set
param.label: Maximum contig coverage (C*avgCvg)
param.name: max_contig_cvg

param.help: Will be used as upper bound of insert size for large insert size ( > 1000) when handling pair-end connections between contigs if b is set to larger than 1
param.label: insertSizeUpperBound
param.name: insert_size_upper_bound

param.label: Bubble coverage
param.name: bubble_coverage

tool.help:
**What it does**
SOAPdenovo is a novel short-read assembly method that can build a de novo draft assembly for the human-sized genomes. The program is specially designed to assemble Illumina GA short reads. It creates new opportunities for building reference sequences and carrying out accurate analyses of unexplored genomes in a cost effective way.
-----
The scaff operation in SOAPdenovo2 analyses the outputs created by the previous SOAPdenovo2 operations and generates the final assembly results. The following outputs are created by the SOAPdenovo2 scaff operation:
1. newContigIndex. Contigs are sorted according their length before scaffolding. Their new index are listed in this file. This is useful if one wants to corresponds contigs in \*.contig with those in \*.links. 2. links. Links between contigs which are established by read pairs. New index are used. 3. scaf_gap. Contigs in gaps found by contig graph outputted by the contiging procedure. Here new index are used. 4. scaf. Contigs for each scaffold: contig index (concordant to index in \*.contig), approximate start position on scaffold, orientation, contig length, and its links to others contigs. 5. gapSeq. Gap sequences between contigs. 6. scafSeq. Sequences of each scaffolds. The final contig sequences can be extracted by breaking down scaffold sequences at gap regions. 7. contigPosInscaff. Contigs' positions in each scaffold. 8. bubbleInScaff. Contigs that form bubble structures in scaffolds. Every two contigs form a bubble and the contig with higher coverage will be kept in scaffold. 9. scafStatistics. Statistic information of the final scaffold and its contigs.
**More information**
For test data and more detailed information, click here_.
.. _here: http://soap.genomics.org.cn/soapdenovo.html
